boardgame.name: Buccaneer
Kalóztámadás
Piraci
The Pirates
Seeräuber
boardgame.description: Each player starts with five chips. To take one of the ship cards, you have to have a stack of chips, the minimum number of chips for each ship being shown on the card. Making the stacks higher is the game's signature gimmick (originating in Die Safeknacker): On your turn, you can take one of your chips, or one of your stacks, and put it on top of one chip or stack of another player, and are then the proud owner of the entire stack. Trouble is, you can't SPEND the stack on a ship until your next turn, by which time somebody else may have taken it away from you by the same process._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Scoring in Die Safeknacker was very streamlined and elegant: You scored the value of the card when you took it and paid off the other players the values of their chips in your stack. In this new version there are complications (tokens to collect, a consolation prize for the player next to the top in the stack) which give you a little more to think about._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implements:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Die Safeknacker_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: played only once and like new +++++ german version, but the game components are completely language independent anyway and you can download various translations from the queen games website +++++ will be shipped with insurance +++++ payment for germany : personal pick up in berlin or bank transfer +++++ payment for usa, canada, asia and australia : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have no euro : paypal or cash (by letter, exchanged already into euros) or bank transfer +++++ payment for european countries, that have euro : direct bank transfer (wich is cost-free !) or cash (by letter) +++++ for all : no checks ! +++++ foreign buyers beware : though german postal is relatively fast, they sadly are not cheap (about 19 - 45 euros, it depends on, where the package has to be shipped or what´s it´s weight), so please ask for prices, before you hit the buy button ! +++++ shipping inside germany will cost 8 euros

Rio Grande Games (RIO 071) Type: Economic Number of players: 3-5 Age of players: 8+ Length: 30 minutes Game Description: All hell is loose near the port. Many of the pirates are casting jealous glances at the riches in the large trading ships which lie at anchor. And so plans are being made to get the lucrative booty.The motley teams are quickly put together and it is decided which ships are to be relieved of their treasures and ducats.But even the strongest captain must take care, as each pirate wants a proper wage for his work. If the booty is too small and the pay too high, the captain will have to pay his team out of his own pocket and that may cost him victory at the end. Author: Stefan Dorra
